topic.title: Error Messages
topic.shortdesc: The types of error messages you may encounter when using your TRS-80 computer.

body.p: There are three kinds of error messages you might get while using your computer:

li.p: Boot errors, such as BOOT ERROR DC. See the Boot Errors Table for more information.
Operating system errors, such as ERROR 24 or FILE NOT FOUND. To get a brief description of a numbered error, type ERROR followed by the error number displayed. For example, type:

body.p: For more information see the System Errors Table.

li.p: Application program errors: see your application program manual.

body.p: When an error message is displayed:

li.p: Look up boot errors and operating system errors in the following tables and take the recommended actions. See your application program manual for explanations of application program errors.
Reset the computer and try the operation again.
Remove all diskettes from drives, turn off the computer, wait 15 seconds, and turn it on again.
If you tried all these remedies and continue to get an error message, contact a Service Center.

note.p: If more than one thing is wrong, the computer might wait until you correct the first error before displaying the second error message.
